Tutorial: ^Well, let me not hold you back any further, I'll..
^What do you mean we ain't ready yet?
^It appears the story isn't ready yet.
^And whatever you will see after this doesn't make sense.

s0: ^But perhaps maybe you would like to have a try at brewing coffee?

Tutorial_Pos_MS2: ^You can go on to enjoy the unready story!
Tutorial_Nor_MS2: ^Well, you can go on to enjoy the unready story!
Tutorial_Bad_MS2: ^Why did you give this to me?
^Urgh, you can go look at the unready story,  I guess.
Day_1_pt_1_1: ^My consciousness rising from the darkness yet again.
^How long has it been since I last woke from my slumber...?
^In this meaningless darkness, I cannot feel or see a single thing,
^yet, I can sense someone calling out for me...
^Who are you? And what do yo-
^As if, someone, somewhere had just switched on the lights.
^Rather, it felt more like as if I had suddenly gained awareness of the concept of light, and the ability to perceive it.
^This smell.... anyone would recognize this smell.
^The sweet aroma of freshly ground coffee, slightly burnt, but nevertheless fruity.
^It is probably a medium roast Abrica from Ethiopia.
^I am not a morning person, but this smell..... makes me wanna get a cup of Latte.
^In fact, I'd do anything for a cup of Latte right now. Like a moth to a flame.
^I see. I must have fallen asleep in front of my laptop whilst pulling an all nighter or something...
^There isn't a computer in front of me.
^Strange.... I must be hearing things then...
^No, no, no, no, no... impossible... wait... wait...
^That sounded like it came directly from inside my head.
^Hahaha.... it can't be right. I must have been wearing a earpiece. That's right! An IEM!
^Before me stood a brown haired young girl wearing an apron of sorts with her eyes wide open, staring straight into my eyes.
^She seems to be in a state of shock.
^In her hands, held a food tray of sorts, raised high above her head as if... as if....
^I raise my arms to protect myself.
^A startled voice coming from a different location.
^The sounds of something metallic getting knocked over.
^Ouchie... eh he he.. I hit my head against the table when I heard you scream.
^Another girl, rises up from the floor.
^This time, is a short black haired bispectacled girl.
^With her hands on the back of her head, massaging it.
^Hehe.... don't look at me like that. It's not like I'm bleeding...
^That's true. But you'll never know. A concussion or something could be possible.
^The brown haired girl swings the tray and uses it to point at me.
^What do you think that is? A sword?
^Well, at least she doesn't look like she is gonna hit me with it anymore.
^This thing started screaming at me all of a sudden!
^Oi oi, both of you, you are hurting my feelings. I'm not this thing.
^Well, I'd be more worried that it didn't.
^Or that if it can only scream....
^Both girls suddenly fall into deep silence, and stared at me.
^The spectacle wearing girl lets out a big sigh.
^Like a cat stretching under the sun.
^Time to clean up this area then...
^Actually, did they just say fixed? Is she some kind of doctor or something?
^Wait then why am I in a cafe?
^Ah ha. This must be one of those underground hospital or something right?
^Sherlyn, don't you think that it's behavior has been pretty weird?
^The girl, who is called Sherlyn, shoots a glance at me.
^See? How it just jerked like that.
^Probably it had a nightmare or something. What cha think, Xiao Mei?
^She puts her hand to her chin and looks down as if in deep thought.
^In the first place, AIs even dream at all?
^Ahh... the classic question: Do androids dream of electric sheep?
^You were the one who brought up the topic. Why are you asking me?
^Is that a question directed to me?
^The two girls stare at me, as if their very next decision depended on my answer.
^Are they going to dissect me if I answered wrongly?
^Is there a politically correct answer to this?
^In the first place, why are the two of them talking to me as if I wasn't a human?
^Both of them froze and looked at each other.
^She utters while pinching the bridge of her nose.
^Cringing, as if I just said something utterly absurd.
^You do know you are A Robot right?
^I mean I had people jokingly say that I work like a robot but...
^The looks on your eyes tell me that you aren't joking.
^Yep, that's definitely not the previous personality.
^I said so. This AI is acting weirdly.
^What what!?!? I- I'm a robot? Since when?
Day_1_pt_1_1_WAI: ^Ah right it doesn't have a GPS chip.
^We are located just beside the largest AI research and robot manufacturing company, OMEGA.
^Quite a number of customers who works there come here for coffee.
^And also students from the nearby University and businessmen who come here for confrences.
^Sometimes I am just glad that we are located in a business park.
^But sometimes it can get pretty crowded, so we need a helping hand.
^I can't help but to feel like she ridiculing me.
Day_1_pt_1_1_WAY: ^It's kinda weird saying this now and you have probably already registered our names in your database already.
^I'm Sheryln and she is Xiao Mei.
^Technically we are sisters, though not related by blood.
^She pauses, before giving a shooting a quick glance at Sherlyn.
^At the corner of my eyes, I can see Sheryln bitting her lips and clenching her first slighty.
^My dad, the owner of the Cafe, adopted her.
^He is hospitalized after a car accident.
^It seems like a difficult topic for the two of them to talk about.
^The hospitalization fees were pretty expensive, and we are now short of hands.
^No one seemed to want to take up this job, and we can't replace Master.
^Why not? The two of you seem capable enough.
^Putting aside Xiao Mei's coffee, I go to school so...
^Hey hey. What do you mean by that!?
^For a young girl of her age, she sure does sigh a lot.
^You'll get wrinkles. It's bad for you.
^Then what's the difference between a Latte and a Cappuccino?
^You could literally see the hair on her skin stand on its ends.
^... One has art and the other doesnt?
^Yep. That confirms it. Please stay away from the coffee maker please and let the robot do it's job.
Day_1_pt_1_1_PP: ^You mentioned previous personality. What's up with that?
^I've never heard an AI suddenly getting a different personality without a full cold reset.
^All of a sudden, her facial expression became serious
^She lightly graps her chin, and seemingly gets lost in thought.
^Copied over? But... it was completely off the network...
^A bug? Can something as sophiscated as this have been a bug...?
^Ah! Right! What about a malware attack? Sounds like something MAGI would do....
^Somehow I have a feeling that she is lost in deep thoughts.
^Earth to Sherlyn! Earth to Sherlyn! Do you respond?
^What if it was the act of the FBI or...
^Xiao Mei shakes our dear mrs lost in thought vigiously.
^A-a-anyway what were we talking about again?
^Yeah, anyway, previously you were more like a normal robot.
^I..... I'll get back at you one day.
^You were indeed more like a normal robot.
^Never speaking to anyone, only taking orders, and would have definitely
^definitely never thought that you were a human.
^It would seem like my previous personality was a pretty boring one.
^Rather, more like a normal robot than who I am now.
Day_1_pt_1_1_cnt: ^So, in summary, the master of the Cafe is hospitalized after a car accident,
^you guys are in the red after paying all the hospitalization fees
^and here am I replacing him as a full time barista here at Hummingbird Cafe.
^That's right. And you will be working under me.
^She exclaims proudly, puffing her chest out.
^No wait! Why are you acting all so smug for? You guys are in the red!
^Sherlyn built you, and you have been working fine with us up till three days ago. Because of..  What was it... a crash?
^And thanks to that I have been sitting here for three days trying to fix you.
^She is. You'd be surprised by the things she make.
^Sherlyn closes the lid of the tool box.
^But the truth is, I didn't do much...
^I love and specialize in creating and fixing things, especially robots.
^Car engines, 3D printers, Vengeful knife welding Voomba that murders anyone who enters your house
^Oi oi, why are you casually saying something something as dangerous as that?
^I don't know much about AI and how they work.
^The old man at the junkyard gave me your personality core when I asked if they had any cores.
^"Here, take this old junk" he said
^"No one buys ancient junk like this anyway. Not even the scrappers."
^"Just take it, it'd cost more to recycle it."
^Putting that aside, I didn't do much to fix you on the software side of things.
^I'd be surprised if you fixed yourself but...
^Through the lens of an amateur like me, it seems like someone or something was fixing you.
^You mean someone has been entering our cafe late at night?
^No, if that is so, the alarms would have tripped and at the very least we would have found the person in out CCTV records.
^A malware attack would have been more likely.
^Sherlyn... you.... thank you... for following up my joke..
^Like the things MAGI has been doing on the news?
^Yeah. Maybe a hacking attempt on a poor robotic barista. Maybe that's why you crashed in the first place.
^Anyway, I'll ask my friends for their opinions or something. For now I gotta go to school.
^To school? Aren't you working here too?
^She is but, her shift isn't on Tuesdays and also she had been working on you the past 3 days.
^So it wouldn't be fair if I asked her to stay.
^Ah. No wonder she isn't wearing the same apron as Xiao Mei.
^Don't fall asleep in classes. Listen carefully to your lecturer, he must have been pretty smart to get a teaching role at a university.
^That sounds like something I should be saying to you.
^At least, that's the kind of student I'd imagine you to be if you were in my class.
^Oh yeah! Oh wait in that case....
^As if she had only just thought about this idea.
^Why don't cha make a cup of coffee for Sherlyn?
^It's fine, Imma just sleep during the boring lectures.
^You can't do that that! That's problematic for me if the person who saved me were to flunk school because she was too busy fixing me.
^Come on. It's on me. What would you like?
^Honestly I don't know why are you acting all so hyped up. We are just doing a calibration check.
^Your so mean! Calibration check? I am honestly just trying to pour my heart out to you.
^Calibration checks are something that a barista do everyday for the sake of our customers.
^Anyway, while you are at it, could you do me a favor?
^The Analyze feature. I don't actually remember installing this feature inside, but I didn't want to brick you so I didn't uninstall it.
Tutorial_Fail: ^Hey, this isn't what I asked for.
Tutorial_Pos: ^Her eyes light up, as if sparkling
^ is nice once in a while eh.
Tutorial_Bad: ^Without uttering a single word, she picks up the cup.
^She quickly sets down the cup on the table without uttering a single word.
^Looking into her eyes, I could tell that she is screaming internally.
^I could visually see her die on the inside.
^"Watch People Die Inside | Funny Compilation | Click Subscribe!"
^Would have been the title of the TewTube video if I uploaded what I just saw.
^I'm pretty sure that goes against the country's privacy law, and I'm not that kind of person so...
^She is definitely.... unhappy.. but not really in the bad way.
^Woah, I haven't seen her like this since Dad made her taste all the drinks on the menu that she dislikes.
^Is that a good thing or a bad thing?
^Well, she didn't spit it out immediately, so I guess, technically you passed quality checks?
Day_1_pt_1_2: ^It's kinda weird saying this now and you have probably already registered our names in your database already.
^Mrs Sherlyn See ya, please pay attention to class!
^The two of them ignore your joke attempt.
^Xiao mei turns around and was about to pick up the cup Sherlyn had just used
^When she suddenly freezes, turning back around with a smile on her face.
^Let's take a photo to tell our customers that we are open again!
^Ehh... Just the robot itself would be enough.
^No can do. You are also a key attraction to our cafe.
^Doesn't look like Sherlyn noticed, but I definately heard it.
^Yep. Number one gal in Hummingbird, Mrs Sherlyn!
^Stop it, shouldn't you be number one?
^Well... I guess it is true then, I am indeed a robot barista arm now.
^I really have to go now, or I'll be late.
^Although usually the chimes of the door would tell us that a customer has arrived.
^This time, it is the sad sound of my savior leaving me.
^Yes. Under normal circumstances, I should be happy and await for her eventual return.
^WHAT IF SHE GETS TRANSPORTED TO A DIFFERENT WORLD?!
^W-What kind of nonsense are you spouting this time round?!
^She throws a towel at my face.
^Not that I can feel pain actually. Nor would that actually have hurt.
^If you have the time to think of nonsense than clean your station and prepare for customers!
